00100 
00101 =head2 loadMacros
00102 
00103     loadMacros(@macroFiles)
00104 
00105 loadMacros takes a list of file names and evaluates the contents of each file. 
00106 This is used to load macros which define and augment the PG language. The macro
00107 files are searched for in the directories specified by the array referenced by
00108 $macrosPath, which by default is the current course's macros directory followed
00109 by WeBWorK's pg/macros directory. The latter is where the default behaviour of
00110 the PG language is defined. The default path is set in the global.conf file.
00111 
00112 Macro files named PG.pl, IO.pl, or dangerousMacros.pl will be loaded with no
00113 opcode restrictions, hence any code in those files will be able to execute
00114 privileged operations. This is true no matter which macro directory the file is
00115 in. For example, if $macrosPath contains the path to a problem library macros
00116 directory which contains a PG.pl file, this file will be loaded and allowed to
00117 engage in privileged behavior.
00118 
00119 =head3 Overloading macro files
00120 
00121 An individual course can modify the PG language, for that course only, by
00122 duplicating one of the macro files in the system-wide macros directory and
00123 placing this file in the macros directory for the course. The new file in the
00124 course's macros directory will now be used instead of the file in the
00125 system-wide macros directory.
00126 
00127 The new file in the course macros directory can by modified by adding macros or
00128 modifying existing macros.
00129 
00130 =head3 Modifying existing macros
00131 
00132 I<Modifying macros is for users with some experience.>
00133 
00134 Modifying existing macros might break other standard macros or problems which
00135 depend on the unmodified behavior of these macors so do this with great caution.
00136 In addition problems which use new macros defined in these files or which depend
00137 on the modified behavior of existing macros will not work in other courses
00138 unless the macros are also transferred to the new course.  It helps to document
00139 the  problems by indicating any special macros which the problems require.
00140 
00141 There is no facility for modifying or overloading a single macro. The entire
00142 file containing the macro must be overloaded.
00143 
00144 Modifications to files in the course macros directory affect only that course,
00145 they will not interfere with the normal behavior of WeBWorK in other courses.
00146 
00147 =cut
00148 
00149 our $debugON =0;

00164 #   ${main::macrosPath}
00165 # Global macros used

00168 # Because of the need to use the directory variables it is tricky to define this
00169 # in translate.pl since, as currently written, the directories are not available
00170 # at that time.  Perhaps if I rewrite translate as an object that method will work.
00171 
00172 # The only difficulty with defining loadMacros inside the Safe compartment is that
00173 # the error reporting does not work with syntax errors.
00174 # A kludge using require works around this problem

00207 # new 
00208 #   Create one loadfiles object per question (and per PGcore object)
00209 #   Process macro files
00210 #   Keep list of macro files processed.
00211 sub new {
00212     my $class = shift;  
00213     my $envir = shift;  #pointer to environment hash
00214     warn "PGloadmacros must be called with an environment" unless ref($envir) eq 'HASH';
00215     my $self = {
00216         envir       =>  $envir,
00217         macroFileList    => {},    # records macros used in compilation
00218         pgFileName       => '',    # current pg file being processed
00219         server_root_url  => '',    # how do we find this?
00220         macrosPath       => '',
00221         pwd              => '',    # current directory -- defined in initialize
00222     };
00223     bless $self, $class;
00224     $self->initialize;
00225     #$self->check_parameters;
00226     return $self;
00227 }
00228 sub initialize {
00229     my $self = shift;
00230     my $templateDirectory = $self->{envir}->{templateDirectory};
00231     my $pwd = $self->{envir}->{fileName};
00232     $pwd =~ s!/[^/]*$!!;
00233     $pwd = $templateDirectory.$pwd unless substr($pwd,0,1) eq '/';
00234     $pwd =~ s!/tmpEdit/!/!;
00235     $self->{pwd} = $pwd;    
00236     $self->{macrosPath} = $self->{envir}->{pgDirectories}->{macrosPath};
00237     
00238 }
00239 
00240 sub PG_restricted_eval {
00241     my $self = shift;
00242     WeBWorK::PG::Translator::PG_restricted_eval(@_);
00243 }
00244 sub PG_macro_file_eval {
00245     my $self = shift;
00246     WeBWorK::PG::Translator::PG_macro_file_eval(@_);
00247 }

00250 # ^function loadMacros
00251 # ^uses time_it
00252 # ^uses $debugON
00253 # ^uses $externalTTHPath
00254 # ^uses findMacroFile
00255 sub loadMacros {
00256     my $self = shift;
00257     my @files = @_;
00258     my $fileName;
00259     my $macrosPath = $self->{envir}->{macrosPath};
00260     eval {main::time_it("begin load macros");};
00261     ###############################################################################
00262     # At this point the directories have been defined from %envir and we can define
00263     # the directories for this file
00264     ###############################################################################
00265    
00266     # special case inits
00267 #   foreach my $file ('PG.pl','dangerousMacros.pl','IO.pl') {
00268 #       my $macro_file_name = $file;
00269 #       $macro_file_name =~s/\.pl//;  # trim off the extension
00270 #       $macro_file_name =~s/\.pg//;  # sometimes the extension is .pg (e.g. CAPA files)
00271 #       my $init_subroutine_name = "_${macro_file_name}_init";
00272 #       my $init_subroutine  = eval { \&{$init_subroutine_name} };
00273 #       use strict;
00274 #         my $macro_file_loaded = defined($init_subroutine);
00275 #         warn "dangerousMacros: macro init $init_subroutine_name defined |$init_subroutine| |$macro_file_loaded|" if $debugON;
00276 #       if ( defined($init_subroutine) && defined( &{$init_subroutine} ) ) {
00277 # 
00278 #           warn "dangerousMacros:  initializing $macro_file_name"  if $debugON;
00279 #           &$init_subroutine();
00280 #       }
00281 #   }
00282     #FIXME -- how to check that things are defined properly
00283 #     unless (defined( &DOCUMENT)){
00284 #       warn "WARNING::Please make sure that the DOCUMENT() statement comes before<BR>\n" .
00285 #            " the loadMacros() statement in the problem template.<p>" .
00286 #            " The externalTTHPath variable |$externalTTHPath| was\n".
00287 #            " not defined which usually indicates the problem above.<br>\n";
00288 # 
00289 #     }
00290     #warn "running load macros";
00291     
00292     while (@files) {
00293         $fileName = shift @files;
00294         next  if ($fileName =~ /^PG.pl$/) ;    # the PG.pl macro package is already loaded.
00295 
00296         my $macro_file_name = $fileName;
00297         $macro_file_name =~s/\.pl//;  # trim off the extension
00298         $macro_file_name =~s/\.pg//;  # sometimes the extension is .pg (e.g. CAPA files)
00299         my $init_subroutine_name = "_${macro_file_name}_init";
00300         $init_subroutine_name =~ s![^a-zA-Z0-9_]!_!g;  # remove dangerous chars
00301 
00302         ###############################################################################
00303         # For some reason the "no stict" which works on webwork-db doesn't work on
00304         # webwork.  For this reason the constuction &{$init_subroutine_name}
00305         # was abandoned and replaced by eval.  This is considerably more dangerous
00306         # since one could hide something nasty in a file name.
00307         #  Keep an eye on this ???
00308         # webwork-db used perl 5.6.1 and webwork used perl 5.6.0 
00309         ###############################################################################
00310 
00311         # compile initialization subroutine. (5.6.0 version)
00312 
00313         
00314 #       eval( q{ \$init_subroutine = \\&main::}.$init_subroutine_name);
00315 #       warn "dangerousMacros: failed to compile $init_subroutine_name. $@" if $@;
00316 
00317 
00318         ###############################################################################
00319         #compile initialization subroutine. (5.6.1 version) also works with 5.6.0
00320 
00321         my $init_subroutine  = eval { \&{'main::'.$init_subroutine_name} };
00322 
00323         ###############################################################################
00324 
00325         # macros are searched for in the directories listed in the $macrosPath array reference.
00326 
00327         my $macro_file_loaded = defined($init_subroutine) && defined(&$init_subroutine);
00328         warn "PGloadfiles: macro init $init_subroutine_name defined |$init_subroutine| |$macro_file_loaded|" if $debugON;
00329         unless ($macro_file_loaded) {
00330             warn "loadMacros: loading macro file $fileName" if $debugON;
00331             my $filePath = $self->findMacroFile($fileName);
00332             #### (check for renamed files here?) ####
00333             if ($filePath) {
00334                 $self->compile_file($filePath); 
00335                 warn "loadMacros is compiling $filePath" if $debugON;
00336             }
00337             else {
00338               die "Can't locate macro file |$fileName| via path: |".join("|, |",@{$macrosPath})."|";
00339             }
00340         }
00341         ###############################################################################
00342         # Try again to define the initialization subroutine. (5.6.0 version)
00343         
00344 #       eval( q{ \$init_subroutine = \\&main::}.$init_subroutine_name );
00345 #       warn "dangerousMacros: failed to compile $init_subroutine_name. $@" if $@;
00346 #       $init_subroutine = $temp::rf_init_subroutine;
00347         ###############################################################################
00348         # Try again to define the initialization subroutine. (5.6.1 version) also works with 5.6.0  
00349             
00350            
00351         $init_subroutine  = eval { \&{'main::'.$init_subroutine_name} };
00352 
00353         ###############################################################################
00354         #warn "loadMacros: defining \$temp::rf_init_subroutine ",$temp::rf_init_subroutine;
00355        $macro_file_loaded = defined($init_subroutine) && defined(&$init_subroutine);
00356        warn "PGloadfiles: macro init $init_subroutine_name defined |$init_subroutine| |$macro_file_loaded|"if $debugON;
00357 
00358         if ( $macro_file_loaded ) {
00359             warn "PGloadfiles:  $macro_file_name loaded, initializing $macro_file_name\n" if $debugON;
00360             &$init_subroutine();
00361         }
00362         #warn "main:: contains <br>\n $macro_file_name ".join("<br>\n $macro_file_name ", %main::);
00363     }
00364     #warn "files loaded:", join(" ", keys %{ $self->{macroFileList} });
00365     eval{main::time_it("end load macros");};
00366 }
00367 
00368 
00369 # ^function findMacroFile
00370 # ^uses $macrosPath
00371 # ^uses $pwd
00372 sub findMacroFile {
00373   my $self   = shift;
00374   my $macroFileName = shift;
00375   my $macroFilePath;
00376   my $pwd = $self->{pwd};
00377   foreach my $dir (@{$self->{macrosPath} } ) {
00378     $macroFilePath = "$dir/$macroFileName";
00379     $macroFilePath =~ s!^\.\.?/!$pwd/!;
00380     return $macroFilePath if (-r $macroFilePath);
00381   }
00382   return;  # no file found
00383 }
00384 # errors in compiling macros is not always being reported.
00385 # ^function compile_file
00386 # ^uses @__eval__
00387 # ^uses PG_restricted_eval
00388 # ^uses $__files__
00389 sub compile_file {
00390     my $self     = shift;
00391     my $filePath = shift;
00392     warn "loading $filePath" if $debugON; 
00393     local(*MACROFILE);
00394     local($/);
00395     $/ = undef;   # allows us to treat the file as a single line
00396     open(MACROFILE, "<$filePath") || die "Cannot open file: $filePath";
00397     my $string = <MACROFILE>;
00398     #warn "compiling $string";
00399     my ($result,$error,$fullerror) = $self->PG_macro_file_eval($string);
00400     #eval ('$main::__files__->{pop @main::__eval__} = $filePath');
00401     if ($error) {    # the $fullerror report has formatting and is never empty
00402                 # this is now handled by PG_errorMessage() in the PG translator
00403         #$fullerror =~ s/\(eval \d+\)/ $filePath\n/;   # attempt to insert file name instead of eval number
00404         die "Error detected while loading $filePath:\n$fullerror";
00405 
00406     }
00407     $self->{macroFileList}->{$filePath} =1;
00408     close(MACROFILE);
00409 
00410 }

00417 =head2 sourceAlias
00418 
00419     sourceAlias($path_to_PG_file);
00420 
00421 Returns a relative URL to the F<source.pl> script, which may be installed in a
00422 course's F<html> directory to allow formatted viewing of the problem source.
00423 
00424 =cut
00425 
00426 # ^function sourceAlias
00427 # ^uses PG_restricted_eval
00428 # ^uses %envir
00429 # ^uses $envir{inputs_ref}
00430 # ^uses $envir{psvn}
00431 # ^uses $envir{probNum}
00432 # ^uses $envir{displayMode}
00433 # ^uses $envir{courseName}
00434 # ^uses $envir{sessionKey}
00435 sub sourceAlias {
00436     my $self         = shift;
00437     my $path_to_file = shift;
00438     my $envir        =  PG_restricted_eval(q!\%main::envir!);
00439     my $user         = $envir->{inputs_ref}->{user};
00440     $user            = " " unless defined($user);
00441     my $out = 'source.pl?probSetKey='  . $envir->{psvn}.
00442               '&amp;probNum='          . $envir->{probNum} .
00443               '&amp;Mode='             . $envir->{displayMode} .
00444               '&amp;course='           . $envir->{courseName} .
00445               '&amp;user='             . $user .
00446               '&amp;displayPath='      . $path_to_file .
00447               '&amp;key='              . $envir->{sessionKey};
00448 
00449      $out;
00450 }
